weather_report:
The skies above Downtown San Francisco wear a heavy shroud of gray, a sentinel of the day's forecast. Rain has been falling intermittently, punctuated by the rumble of distant thunder, creating an atmosphere both dusky and electric. The temperature hovers around a cool 54, a fitting backdrop for the damp air laden with the scent of earth and sea. Visibility is obscured, and what little can be seen is veiled in a fine mist, where the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the city’s skyline emerge only through the haze.

As the day wears on, the promise of clearing will come by nightfall, transforming the relentless drizzle into a gentle patter. The air will cool further, eventually settling into the embrace of a low 44, though temperatures might rise slightly as evening advances. One might dress in layers, wrapping up in a waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes, ready to trudge through puddles or find shelter in a cozy café. The day’s murk and moisture extend an invitation to seek indoor pursuits; a leisurely afternoon spent wandering through art galleries or losing oneself in the pages of a book at the local library would fit well within this wet ambiance. Consider exploring the myriad of culinary delights in the nearby eateries, where the warmth of a bowl of soup or the rich aroma of fresh coffee provides a comforting reprieve from the chilling damp of the streets.
